website_summaries.verdict: This is a great option if you're looking for a long, affordable speed ladder.
pros: Durable nylon straps with flat plastic rungs
Reasonably priced for what you get
cons: Some feel the rungs are too narrow and too close together

customer_reviews.title: ... teach at the YMCA and it has been the favorite part for all of the kids that take my ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this innumerable times for a Youth Speed and Agility class that I teach at the YMCA and it has been the favorite part for all of the kids that take my class. A couple rungs have snapped over the last year, but it's easy to just tape them back together with some clear packaging tape. If you're looking for different agility ladder drills, this video covers the basics really well (
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: GETS THE JOB DONE
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and easy to travel with. Great for a quick agility training work out. Because it doesnt come with stakes or anything to connect it to the ground it does pose a little bit of a tripping hazard so I wouldnt say that this is for the beginners. The point of this ladder is to help with speed and agility but in my opinion you have to have some kind of foot work skills already before you start using this product. My fiancee is an ex-college foot ball player and though he trips up sometime using this product he has great recovery reflexes that help keep him from hitting the ground or injurying himself.
customer_reviews.author: Savage

customer_reviews.title: Not good for timing so I taped the last rungs of ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be of decent quality . The only issue I have is that the ladder is made up of two 15 foot ladders (although I haven't actually measured them) connected by velcro however the connecting straps are of different lengths creating a space that is smaller than the other spaces . Not good for timing so I taped the last rungs of the ladder together on top of each other creating a slightly shorter ladder but evenly spaced. Seems to work well . I will update if my opinion of the quality changes .
customer_reviews.author: B-Hop

customer_reviews.title: not professional grade, but fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: At just a buck a foot, this ladder is very affordable. Not professional grade, but would pros really be looking for a buck a foot ladder? The rungs do move, but not so much that we can't finish a workout without readjusting. My daughter uses it regularly and I've used it with her U12 soccer team with good success. Getting it back into the bag is a pain, but far from impossible, as opposed to every inflatable boat that's ever come with a stowable bag (what is the deal with that?) Anyway, it's a great little training tool and I would recommend it to any soccer coach dad.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good Supplemental Training for Youth Soccer
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as the more expensive Skilz version. One of my fellow coaches has the Skilz ladder and I don't see any difference. Endless possibilities of drills. I've used this ladder with 8, 9, and 10-year-olds with good success. They seem to like the challenge of it. Stake it down for it to be more forgiving or lay it out on field turf for the ultimate challenge. There's nowhere to hide when you're the guy that drags a foot. Good supplement for training.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Peters

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and great price! It's essentially two ladders in one held together by velcro. It's heavy duty and the fixed rungs are great! It sat quite flat the very first time I used it (bought for the high school volleyball team I coach.) It's exactly what I wanted. The only improvement I would recommend would be that the carrying bag have a strap to fling over my shoulder. Overall, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: teacher_z14

customer_reviews.title: Great Speed Ladder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! The rungs are fixed so there's no need to worry about setting them up before every session and the rungs appear to be pretty sturdy. I wouldn't think twice about using this ladder on a hard surface... that's how sturdy the rungs are. No problems with the ladder not laying flat. The velcro attachments that hold the two 15ft sections seems like it would do a decent job of holding it together during sessions but I've only ever used one 15ft section at a time. This ladder has thrown a new element into my workout routine and makes doing sprint drills fun!
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Ladder drill
customer_reviews.text: These are not high quailty ladders when compared to the expensive ones. That said, these ladders perform as they are supposed to...they lay on the ground and allow players to do various drills on them. The worst part of these ladders is putting them away after use. The included "key" and clip are cheap and will break. They are also a bit bulky to just throw in your practice bag and take to the field every day. The ladders are useful for training "quick feet" and are worth a purchase as long as the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Yukker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you are an athlete trying to stay in shape and increase you mobility, then this is for you. Nothing beats a good ladder workout. My daughter is wearing this thing out. She is searching on Youtube looking at more training videos trying to find new and more exciting exercises to do with it all the time. Good product. Hard to get back in the carrying bag once out, but most products are like this.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: bought as a present
customer_reviews.text: I'm told this is what they wanted for my grandson to use for agility training for soccer. Footwork between the rungs laying on the ground. And here I thought they finally got a fire escape ladder for their 2n floor! Would work better for that I think. However, they were pleased and it was good quality. I suggested they keep it for fire escape.
customer_reviews.author: Jrvjt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and durable
customer_reviews.text: This speed ladder has been a very important training tool with my soccer team. It is convenient that the ladder breaks into two smaller sections, but the downside there is that there is no place to stake the ladders down when they are separated. The rungs on this ladder have held up much better than anticipated. My players have stepped on them in cleats several times, and the rungs have not even hinted at breaking.
customer_reviews.author: G Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder. Lame carrying bag.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The ladder is easy to use and the fixed rungs work well for training. I'm glad I don't have to worry about the rungs moving. Don't count on the bag though, because it's tiny and I wasn't going to spend the time trying to shove it back into the fragile bag. I have a small duffel bag that works well for carrying purposes though.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy product. I got the long 30 ft and it breaks into two 15 ft. Very heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Cbomb43

customer_reviews.title: excellent ladder
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ladder. The rungs are pined in place and dont slide around which is great. I split them in two and have speed races with my soccer team. The two sections are held togther by velcro which is fine. it comes with a strap to bind them together and a carry bag. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Keith D. Woltersdorf

customer_reviews.title: Ladder is great. I love the fixed rungs
customer_reviews.text: Ladder is great. I love the fixed rungs. They are solidly made. I am a high school line football coach and we've been using these ladders almosy everyday this summer, sometimes on the sidewalk other times on the grass with cleats on. This ladder has been trampled and stomped on countless times and still is perfect shape. Would definately recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.W.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, only reason I didn't rate it a 5 is because the slats won't lay flat even after trying to straighten them out. Minor but it does get in the way on some drills. Other than that it works great especially the ability to create two 15 foot sections. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: T Fo

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The connection is somewhat not the same shape as the other rungs, but it all does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Duer

customer_reviews.title: We have already put it to good use. It's great having the option to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality speed ladder. The rungs are hard plastic which is what we were hoping for. We have already put it to good use. It's great having the option to have one long 30' ladder or two 15's. Highly recommended especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CoachFith

customer_reviews.title: Value buy...practical
customer_reviews.text: This one is one of the cheaper options of the agility ladders available. It comes in a nice handy bag, which makes it easier to carry around. The biggest issue one will find with many agility ladder is that they can get tangled due to the nature of the ladder. However, this one provides a way to store it uncluttered which is very helpful. Flat rungs are great as you won't twist or lose control when you step on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for workouts
customer_reviews.text: These are great, because you can use it as one or two. And since I have twins it works great for two. Their coach suggested the non-adjustable rungs, so that was why we purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: nice!
customer_reviews.text: Came exactly as depicted and very sturdy. I love the addition of the metal thingys(?) to keep it in place. Also came with a nice durable storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Edeline

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Recommend getting some kind of weights for ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Recommend getting some kind of weights for the ends because it moves around if players hit it while doing footwork drills. Length is great and a bonus that it splits into two.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price. Don't spend more for a "name brand". You get the same quality with this product
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Nicoli

customer_reviews.title: Agility Ladder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It arrived on time, came in a convenient carrying case. I would recommend this vendor & product to anyone serious about improving their skills (Also perfect for back to school gift).
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D. Alsabrook, Sr

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great except that some of the rungs are not straight
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great except that some of the rungs are not straight. When assembled, they were attached at an angle; not a 90 degree angel with the side edging. Making some of "squares" smaller or larger. Great price though.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Fast Feet Here we Come
customer_reviews.text: good product, easy to store and easy to set up. Very helpful for footwork speed development. Good quality construction and materials
customer_reviews.author: AdamSch

customer_reviews.title: Kids love to do these
customer_reviews.text: We use these all the time at practice for basketball, football, baseball, you name it. Kids love to do these!
customer_reviews.author: Reghan Denny

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what people are talking about when they say the rungs move...mine is just like the one in the picture...the rungs are riveted to the nylon strap and cannot move!!! the only way it would be any easier to use is if someone took it out of the bag and laid it out for you! great product and my daughter loves it. would definitly buy again. Yes if your feet hit the strap or rungs it will move....but the whole idea is to learn to move your feet and not hit those area!
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Hill

customer_reviews.title: ... high and low for fixed rungs and there were perfect, never going back to the ones that can ...
customer_reviews.text: I searched high and low for fixed rungs and there were perfect, never going back to the ones that can move.
customer_reviews.author: JRDGZ

customer_reviews.title: Decent ladder for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got it for the kids to improve foot work in the back yard. I like the flexibility of having 1 long or 2 shorter ladders. Easy to put back in carry bag. Product is what I expected and great for light use.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. I bought a ladder 8 years ago and it will last forever. I had to buy another one because it was stolen. 🤷🏽‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Couper Smith Hagans

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This agility ladder was for my son. He's used it several times and really likes it. Training for football and track. A lot longer than some of the ones they use at school.
customer_reviews.author: The Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder(s)
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an exercise ladder for the soccer team that I'm coaching, and this ladder worked perfectly. It is extremely convenient having either one very long ladder or two normal sized ladders. The carrying bag provided is a bit small, but I've found another bag to use instead, and it does not come with spikes to achor to the ground. This ladder has been a great addition to the practice routine.
customer_reviews.author: Clevey

customer_reviews.title: great ladder
customer_reviews.text: It's a great agility ladder - flat, bright rungs, and it is separateable into two, if necessary. Have been using it for a few months and it is still like new.
customer_reviews.author: acoustimate

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ladder. Buit to last with solid construction. The carrying case is nice, but I suspect it will not make it through two season.
customer_reviews.author: S. Seaney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for conditioning and agility drills. Bought these to spark up my workout for the Rugby offseason. You can put it together as (1) 30ft run or (2) 15 runs. I suggest pairing this up with the 2- Disc Cones or miniature hurdles for a circuit series.
customer_reviews.author: Banks!

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: We used it everyday with my soccer team !! Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Mariona

customer_reviews.title: Nice agility ladder
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't expect it to be so long, but it's great. I would recommend this to anybody that needs a great agility ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Tnice

customer_reviews.title: great price for 30 ft
customer_reviews.text: Does it slip a bit? yes, but thats what its designed to do. you want to be able to see where your mistakes are so you can correct them. Recomended if you know what you're doing. If you don't, buy the ladder dvd combo.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Long, light, and cheap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Cintz 30 ft adjustable Speed Agility ladder 2 weeks ago and have used it a few times with my son. Pros: Cheapest ladder on the market Long as advertised Lightweight Cons: Adjustable rungs move VERY easily (basically, if you touch them they move) Difficult to wrap up and due to the fact that the rungs move too much If you just need something for light home use then this will work. Otherwise, spend a little extra for a higher-end product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Yeah!
customer_reviews.text: This is so convenient that it comes in a carrying bag. It's weighted down just right. It has been a lot of fun using it for games with little kids.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLOTTE

customer_reviews.title: Cintz 20 ft Adjustable speed ladder
customer_reviews.text: Great Item! 30ft is just the perfect length, any shorter and it would be too easy. I bought this for coaching a track team. If there is a downside to the item, it would be that it is adjustable because sometimes it adjusts to easily (like in the middle of setting it up or after a bunch of people went through) But that is to be expected. If you need to adjust it back, it is really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the length of this ladder for my more experienced ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the length of this ladder for my more experienced athletes but the velcro in the middle only lasted 2 sessions. Had to sew it together and use extra ground spikes to secure it so it would not break in the middle of drills
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Used it at the beach on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Used it at the beach on the sand. So far it's been very durable. Like the fixed rungs. Ladder lays nicely and doesn't tangle despite multiple uses. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Rusty!!!
customer_reviews.text: The ladder was what I wanted but the metal fasteners that hold the plastic to the canvas were rusted and rust had rubbed all over the canvas. Dont know how long it would hold together.
customer_reviews.author: S A

customer_reviews.title: Gets a Lot of Use!
customer_reviews.text: The carrying case for this is a bit weak and the 'peg' used to neatly retract the ladder doesnt fit in the bag in this form. This makes it hard to stuff in the bag and keep in a neat pile with out the straps tangling up. Otherwise, this gets a lot of use from my clients, and myself. Very portable and versatile!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen H. Melter

customer_reviews.title: like how the rungs are riveted into place and can ...
customer_reviews.text: very durable, like how the rungs are riveted into place and can not move. I used this 3 days a week for my girls U11 soccer team and not signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Kruger

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Economical but very ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Economical but very average quality. Is not provided with steaks to anchor into the ground. You will need to pick up four small rod type tent steaks at your local outdoor shop.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: This speed ladder rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This speed ladder really meets the needs of a youth soccer coach. The kids can perform their drills and have fun doing it. Once of the best features is the ability to split the ladder into two 15ft sections. This allows for two groups to run the speed drills simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Arsenal FC

customer_reviews.title: Just get them - you'll like them!
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff! I like that they are detachable; sometimes it's better to have two 15 ft ladders instead. Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Victor

customer_reviews.title: Did everything asked of it
customer_reviews.text: This product did everything asked of it. Which really was for it to lay there and be and agility ladder. It wasn't that easy to get back into its bag, but considering the combination of hard and soft parts plus its length, I didn't expect it to be easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: What I wanted
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly as I thought it would be, which is what I wanted. Thank You Again would purchase another
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: Best ladder set yet
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the 15ft one this 30ft is actually 2 15ft and is much more sturdy that the 15ft by it self great buy will refer my coaches to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used for middle school football players to teach them to control their feet. Invaluable coaching tool
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: poorly made
customer_reviews.text: product was of poor quality. the ladder was made incorrectly and the side straps were twisted up. poor quality control. had to return it for a refund. get the SKLZ brand of equipment, the quality is much better.
customer_reviews.author: JAJBA

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and heavy enough that they stay down on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Rungs are fixed, sturdy and heavy enough that they stay down on the field. U-8 kids used it for the first time on Tuesday and had a great time competing against each other. Awesome that it splits into two 15 footers.
customer_reviews.author: David Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Cintz 30 ft Fixed rungs Soccer Speed and Agility ladder in a bag
customer_reviews.text: An outstanding product and definitely worth the price you pay. Was shipped in a timely manner and once received was able to implement it into my children's daily training for all of their sports they play throughout the year.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM FLATT

customer_reviews.title: It looks like a great product.,
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the product and it was delivered fast!
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I am a Physical Education teacher. I just pulled this out on Tuesday to use in a classroom as the gym was not available. The students loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend the Extra Money
customer_reviews.text: This ladder has smaller boxes than typical ladders. The rungs also slide and change position very easily if stepped on. This takes time away from training having to realign the rungs instead of just straightening the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: agility ladder
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Comes in two 15 ft sections that use velcro to hold them together. The rungs can be adjusted by sliding them but they stay in place well- not alot of adjustment needed. Fits nicely in the bag. So far I am very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: The ladder itself is ok but not great quality as the material is all twisted and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The ladder itself is ok but not great quality as the material is all twisted and the bag it comes in was tore and frayed after one use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was the cheapest one
customer_reviews.text: I am an expert with ladder drills so, I hardly ever touch it when doing drills. But my cousin's feet are terrible and he broke one of them just by stepping on it. Pretty good ladder tho.
customer_reviews.author: dionte dinkins

customer_reviews.title: Ladders
customer_reviews.text: the ladders are ok but not very stable on the corners. But better then ones that are out on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Mustafa CeliK

customer_reviews.title: Coach
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is great! It is 30 feet long, but can be split into two, has a holder that keeps them from getting tangled, and has a carrying bag. Also, they lie flat and are not a hazard like some of those with tubing.
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder. I appreciate that it can be split ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Ladder. I appreciate that it can be split into 2 so I can use it for drills as one or split it for team races.
customer_reviews.author: fergyferg

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I own several of these all by different brands but for the money this one is one of the best. Especially like that I can take it apart and have 2 shorter ladders
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for a nice speed ladder. Looks good. Well made. Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: paul cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Kyle's mom
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it. He is 15 and he loves it. You just need to make sure to keep it neat when you put it away or it will get all twisted.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good agility workout
customer_reviews.text: Good agility workout, And 30 ft for maximum performance output. Very useful tool, makes me look forward to competing this upcoming season.
customer_reviews.author: DeVarius Moody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Product comes in nice storage bag. Ladder is durable and separates into 2 pieces for additionial drills. Recommend for people working on agility.
customer_reviews.author: Tonka

customer_reviews.title: awesome product
customer_reviews.text: this is an awesome training tool. it easily changes from one 30' ladder to two 15' ladders. highly recommended! woo!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fitness ladder
customer_reviews.text: Very awesome equipment! The plastic doesn't move up or down on the ladder and as a fitness instructor this is key when teaching a large class how to run through a ladder drill.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is a bargain. At first I didn't see the Velcro straps at the 15th foot mark, but after close inspection I was able to find them.
customer_reviews.author: DUSTINZB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid quality. I can tell it's going to last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Price

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my field hockey team. I like that it separates into two and the rungs do not move.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Rioux

customer_reviews.title: Love the ladder
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this was the best ladder to buy...Best value for a 30 footer. Plus it breaks into two 15 ft ladders. It has worked exactly as intended for my soccer team. I'd recommend not paying more for any other speed ladder on the market.
customer_reviews.author: L Michael

customer_reviews.title: Agility ladders
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Easy and safe to use on all surfaces. A worthwhile and smart investment.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Merrill

product_meta.title: Cintz Speed Agility Ladder - Heavy Duty Fixed Rungs
feature_bullets: Comes with ground anchors and a carry bag
